summary: Donald Trump claimed during a campaign event in Florida on June 19th, 2019 that the system is rigged, citing the contrast between the extensive investigation into his actions versus the leniency shown towards Hillary Clinton and her aides for their mishandling of classified information. He emphasized the deletion and acid washing of 33,000 emails by Clinton, suggesting that if he had done the same, he would face severe consequences. Trump expressed hope that the newly appointed attorney general would address this issue. He urged his supporters to vote on November 3rd and emphasized that corrupt politicians will only understand the impact of their actions through a significant electoral defeat.

Donald Trump claimed during a campaign event in Florida on June 19th, 2019 that wages are rising at the fastest rate in many decades, particularly for the lowest income Americans. He also mentioned that nearly 10 million Americans have been provided with private-sector training opportunities through Ivanka Trump's efforts. Additionally, he highlighted the passing of the largest package of tax cuts and reforms in American history, which included doubling the child-tax credit and providing a tax cut of over $2,000 a year for a typical family of four earning $75,000. Trump also emphasized the positive impact of his administration's regulatory reduction campaign and the reversal of the previous administration's energy policies.
